intro: Canthium obovatifolium, commonly known as the broad-leafed spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with simple, alternate leaves that are ovate to elliptic in shape. Its small, greenish-yellow flowers are clustered in cyathia, which are specialized structures typical of the spurge family. Canthium obovatifolium is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
